title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: A 38-year-old woman was found dead on Newhall Street in Lynn early Sunday, authorities reported.
A 30-year-old Lynn man has been arrested and charged with murder in connection to the death.
The suspect is set to be arraigned in Lynn District Court on Monday, names not released yet.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers confirms he is happy with the Raiders despite a recent trade request denied by the team.
Meyers caught eight passes for 97 yards in the Raiders' 20-13 win against the Patriots in Foxborough.
Meyers, in the final year of his contract, seeks a new deal after joining the Raiders in 2023 for $33 million.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A radar-confirmed tornado touched down in Holden, Massachusetts, on Saturday, according to the National Weather Service.
The severe weather system prompted tornado warnings across northwestern Massachusetts, including Worcester and Springfield areas.
Crews managed power outages and fallen trees in Holyoke and Paxton; no injuries were reported.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots lost their season opener to the Raiders, 20-13, despite early offensive promise.
New England's defense showed improvement, with Harold Landry III recording 2.5 sacks.
Quarterback Drake Maye struggled in the second half, contributing to the team's offensive challenges.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Will Campbell, Patriots rookie left-tackle, struggled with penalties and sacks in his NFL debut against the Raiders.
Mike Vrabel expressed mixed feelings about Campbell's performance, citing areas for improvement after reviewing game tape.
The Patriots lost 20-13 to the Raiders, struggling offensively despite rookie quarterback Drake Maye's 46 passing attempts.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Lynn police officer was placed on leave after appearing 'suddenly incapacitated' during a traffic stop.
Video shows the officer unresponsive, blinking slowly, and struggling to stand, leading to a public investigation.
Lynn police are investigating all possible factors, stating the incident likely resulted from a medical episode.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost 20-13 to the Raiders in Mike Vrabel's debut as coach at Gillette Stadium.
Harold Landry III excelled with 2.5 sacks, contributing significantly to the Patriots' defense.
The Patriots' running backs had a rough game, totaling 60 yards on 18 carries with only TreVeyon Henderson exceeding 15 yards.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Dropkick Murphys and The Hold Steady performed at the Seisiún festival at Suffolk Downs on September 6, 2025.
A thunderstorm caused a rain delay, leading to a two-hour evacuation and rescheduling of the festival lineup.
Despite the weather, Dropkick Murphys delivered an energetic performance, featuring songs like 'The Boys Are Back' and 'I'm Shipping Up To Boston'.

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick confirmed banning a Patriots scout from UNC practices, citing unwelcome treatment at both facilities.
The decision follows a strained relationship between Belichick and the Patriots after his departure in 2023.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel chose not to comment extensively on the ban, prioritizing focus on his team.

title: 6 takeaways from Patriots’ 20-13 loss to Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots lost 20-13 to the Raiders after a second-half offensive collapse, being outscored 13-3 post-halftime.
Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards, 1 touchdown, and 1 interception, with 336 total offensive yards.
Harold Landry shone defensively with 2.5 sacks in his Patriots debut, while Kayshon Boutte led receiving with 103 yards.
